newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Abiove soybean crush 1.8 mln tonnes in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Abiove soybean crush 1.8 mln tonnes in Sept.

text.p: Brazilian firms contributing data to the Brazilian Vegetable Oils Industries Association (ABIOVE) crushed 1.8 million tonnes of soybeans in September, down from 1.94 million in August, ABIOVE said.
Total crushings in the first eight months of the marketing year (February/January) now reached 14.19 million tonnes.
ABIOVE estimates the data it receives represents 91 to 93 percent of total Brazilian crushings.
As well as using domestic soybeans, imports between February and September totalled 750,000 tonnes, Abiove said.
The September figure left industry stocks at 3.11 million tonnes, down from 4.03 million at the end of August.
Crushings last year in September when contributing companies represented 100 percent of the sector reached 1.95 million tonnes, according to ABIOVE statistics.
Stocks at the end of the month in 1995 reached 3.89 million tonnes.
-- Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151
